domosaics.ui
Class ViewHandler

java.lang.Object
  domosaics.ui.ViewHandler

public class ViewHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Class ViewManager manages the creation, adding and removing of view objects to Angstd and its main frame. The adding to the workspace view is delegated to the WorkspaceManager.

The class follows the singleton pattern, which means only one instance is created during the applications lifetime. To get an instance of ViewManager, use the static getInstance() method.

To add a view to the main frame its necessary to call in a first step the createView(ViewType, String) method where a new View object is created using the AngstdViewFactory. After the object is created it has to be added by calling addView(View, ProjectElement). Now for everything is taken care of (meaning e.g. the view is added to the workspace automatically as well).

Because Tools like the DomainDotplot or the DomainLegend are views as well (the difference is they are stored in an extra frame and not within the workspace) This class also manages the tool handling.

Author:
Andreas Held

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ViewHandler getInstance()
Returns the current ViewManager instance. If not initialized, it creates a new instance. This is the method which should be used to initialize the ViewManager.

Returns:
the ViewManager instance

createView

public <V extends View> V createView(ViewType type,
                                     java.lang.String name)
Uses the AngstdViewFactory to create a new view object of the specified type. This method does not automatically add the created object to the AngstdDesktop. To do that its necessary to invoke addView() with the created view object.

Type Parameters:
V - the generic view type (e.g. DomainViewI)
Parameters:
type - the type of the view to be created (e.g. ViewType.DOMAINS)
name - the name for the view displayed in the workspace
Returns:
the created view object for the specified type

addView

public void addView(View view,
                    ProjectElement project)
Adds a view to the AngstdDesktop and to the workspace. The view is stored in the view mapping using its ID. Therefore this id must be unique (associated automatically when using the AngstdViewFactory.
The project is allowed to be null in which case the view is added to the currently selected project element.

Parameters:
view - The view to be added
project - The project to which the view should be added (allowed to be null)

removeView

public void removeView(ViewInfo info)
Completely eliminates a view from Angstd. If you are just interested in removing the view from the desktop but not from the workspace, you may be interested in disableView().

Parameters:
info - the view to remove

enableView

public void enableView(int viewID)
enables a view which means that it gets displayed within the mainframe.

Parameters:
viewID - the viewID of the view which is about to be displayed

disableActiveView

public void disableActiveView()
Removes the active view from the domosaics desktop.

getView

public <V extends View> V getView(ViewInfo viewInfo)
Returns the queried view based on its unique id stored within the view info.

Type Parameters:
V - the generic view type (e.g. DomainViewI)
Parameters:
viewInfo - the view info of the requested view
Returns:
the requested view

countViews

public int countViews()
Counts the number of created views (not Tools) stored in the workspace.

Returns:
number of created views

getActiveView

public <V extends View> V getActiveView()
Return the actually displayed View

Type Parameters:
V - the generic view type (e.g. DomainViewI)
Returns:
actually displayed View
